id.desc: The global unique id of the list entry

exclusive_cluster_usage.desc: During the IO500 benchmark execution was the system entirely dedicated to running the benchmark, if so, select YES. If there were other jobs running in the same cluster and storage system, select NO.

version.desc: The version of the IO500 used

nodeTypeName.desc: The type of the nodes (matching the node name description as part of the supercomputer) that executed the benchmark

number_clientNodes.desc: The number of nodes that executed the IO500

procsPerNode.desc: The number of processes that executed the IO500 benchmark per Node

number_serverNodes.desc: Total number of servers (for both data and metadata)

note.desc: Any other information you may find useful

annual maintanance costs.desc: Costs for the upkeep of the component

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

name.desc: Name of the node configuration (could be the hostname prefix)

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

distribution.desc: The distribution of your operating system

distribution version.desc: The version of the distribution kernel, e.g., 20.04.1

kernel version.desc: The version of the (Linux) kernel, e.g., 5.3.0-1028-azure

compute peak.desc: Theoretic double precision FLOPS of all CPUs and accelerators

installation date.desc: Installation date of the nodes YYYY-MM-DD

Cooling.desc: Type of the cooling for the nodes

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

peak throughput.desc: The theoretic throughput to read/write data

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

count.desc: Number of storage devices in one server

interface.desc: The storage interface, i.e., how is the storage attached

raw capacity.desc: Raw capacity without overhead for fault-tolerance

cores per socket.desc: Number of physical cores per socket

threads per core.desc: Number of logical cores per CPU (SMT)

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

links.desc: The number of physical network links of this interconnect type

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

slots.desc: The number of slots for tapes

robots.desc: The number of robots serving tapes

SCHEMES_multi: Servers:Servers:A set of identical configured DAOS servers
Servers:Servers:A set of identical configured Weka servers
Data Servers:GPFSDataServers:A set of GPFS data servers
Metadata Servers:GPFSMetadataServers:A set of GPFS metadata servers

protocol.desc: The protocol used for communication with storage and metadata

SCHEMES_multi: Metadata Server:Servers:The specification of the server running the BeeGFS server process for metadata
Storage Server:Servers:The specification of the server running the BeeGFS server process for storage targets

protocol.desc: The protocol for connection to clients

protocol version.desc: The version of the protocol in use.

transfer protocol.desc: The protocol for connection to clients

name.desc: Name of the server, e.g., hostname

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

distribution.desc: The distribution of your operating system

distribution version.desc: The version of the distribution kernel, e.g., 20.04.1

kernel version.desc: The version of the (Linux) kernel, e.g., 5.3.0-1028-azure

installation date.desc: Installation date of the nodes YYYY-MM

refresh date.desc: The most recent date when the storage system underwent significant changes such as reformat or growth. format: MM/YYYY

Cooling.desc: Type of the cooling for the nodes

model.desc: Exact model description of the component

slots.desc: The number of slots for tapes

robots.desc: The number of robots serving tapes

model.desc: Exact model description of the component
Exact model description of the component
Exact model description of the component

institution.desc: Name of the institution full name

annual staff costs.desc: Costs for the overall site staff per year

installation date.desc: Installation date of the supercomputer YYYY-MM

compute peak.desc: Double precision FLOPS of all CPUs and accelerators

bisection bandwidth.desc: Bisection bandwidth of the network / maximum throughput

blocking factor.desc: The blocking factor of the network

model.desc: Model is applicable for vendor storage hardware to wrap the whole hardware configuration with details (e.g. DDN AI400X vs. AI400X2)

usage.desc: How is the storage system used. Production means the storage system is used with end-users and must be stable

overlapping_compute_storage.desc: Are actually the compute nodes providing the storage

overlapping_metadata_dataServers.desc: Is metadata and data stored on the same servers

frameworks.desc: Software frameworks used for the development

client storage access.desc: How does the client access the storage? e.g. via a kernel mount

client mount options.desc: The options used in the mount command on the client

installation date.desc: Installation date of the storage YYYY-MM

net capacity.desc: Net, i.e., usable capacity of the overall storage system, includes redundancy measures

raw capacity.desc: Capacity of the overall storage system without redundancy
